To my L. Treasuro
r
July 21.
90

page.lettertext:
fol.221r
Belgia 1590 21 July To my L. Trea
s
Belgia:
According to yo
r
L lett
r
to
M
r
Wilk
& mee I do alwaies endevo
r
to make
e best
construction of that w
ch
was deliv
r
ed to
Mons
r
de S
t
Aldegonde
. I do not und
r
stand
it to bee yo
r
L. meaning, that I should have come to
e
states
w
th
to long discourse: but
I have signifyed unto th
e
in theyr full assembly, & in
e p
nc
e of M
r
Wilk
, that
wheras of late I had used some speech unto th
e
astouching Mons
r
de S
t
Aldegonde
I was [now] advertised fr
o
her
Ma
ty
,
t
being come agayn into
England
, & bringing
w
th
h
y
e
French K
letters, hee had purged himself in so good sort, as her Hig
nes
desyred no furder satisfaction, & th
r
upon also shee had given mee in charge, to
entreat th
e
in like manner in her behalf to put all in oblivion, as yf no such
matter had happened, & to beare that affection unto him, as they have don
heretofore & his qualityes deserve./ To my best und
r
standing yt was not needfull
to say any more, & yt seemed sufficient to content th
e
, who signifyed unto mee that
they were very glad to heare that her Ma
ty
had Rxd so good satisfaction. notw
th
standing
that
e g
na
ll states have heth
r
too
ceded very slowly & untowardly w
th
M
r
Wilk
& mee in o
r
oth
r
buisnes, as by o
r
letter joyntly signed yo
r
L. may
ceave
yet wee are told underhand, that they are
tly resolved to retourne some
better aunsweres, wee are also put in hope that in regard of that declaration
w
ch
her Ma
ty
hath signed, & wee have shewed, but not delivered unto them
wee shall induce th
e
to publish a generall oblivion & restitution to theyr
former states, if not for all [ther] for the greater
te of those
sons, that
are that way charged, w
ch
I do ass ure yo
r
L. for many weighty respect
is
no lesse expedient to bee urged & obtayned, then whatsoev
r
d[ls] of o
r
charge
that may touche her Ma
tyes
service./
